summary: The '9–8–8 Lifeline Cybersecurity Responsibility Act' aims to protect the 9–8–8 National Suicide Prevention Lifeline from cybersecurity threats. It mandates the program's network administrator and participating local/regional crisis centers to report identified vulnerabilities and incidents to the Assistant Secretary. The bill also tasks the Comptroller General with studying cybersecurity risks and vulnerabilities associated with the Lifeline and submitting a report to relevant congressional committees.
